titlepage.titleproper: Records of the Office of the Vice President for Academic Affairs and the Office of the Vice President for Special Projects, Alfred Krebs, 1963-1976
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections RG 5/1/2/1

defitem.label: Processed by: Jennifer Vipperman, Archives Assistant, and Tamara Kennelly, University Archivist,

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Records of the Office of the Vice President for Academic Affairs and the Office of the Vice President for Special Projects, Alfred Krebs, 1963-1976
did.physloc: Please note: This collection is located in off-site storage and requires 2-3 days notice for retrieval. Contact Special Collections for more information.
did.physdesc: This collection has digitized material available online.
did.abstract: The collection consists primarily of the correspondence and other materials of Alfred Krebs in his capacity as Vice President for Special Projects (1975-1976). The collection also includes materials from his period as Interim Vice President for Academic Affairs (1972-1975). His duties as Vice President for Special Projects included university financial functions, chairmanship of the Computer Committee, Systems Development, Institutional Research, and the coordination of the Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Programs. There are materials regarding such subjects as consulting projects, cases from the Judicial Review committee, the Telecommunication Committee, and the University Council. Correspondence and other documents detail the formation and management of the Computer Committtee, the creation and implementation of an Affirmative Action Plan,and procedures for implementing Title IX regulations.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Records of the Office of the Vice President for Academic Affairs and the Office of the Vice President for Special Projects, Alfred Krebs must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Records of the Office of the Vice President for Academic Affairs and the Office of the Vice President for Special Projects, Alfred Krebs, RG 5/1/2/1, University Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was acquired by Special Collections prior to 2002.

altformavail.head: Alternate Form Available
altformavail.p: This collection has digitized material available online.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement and description of the collection began in March 2007 and was completed in December 2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Alfred H. Krebs (1920-2012) earned a bachelor's, master's, and Ph.D. from Cornell University and served in the U.S. Army during World War II. He taught agricultural education at the University of Illinois at Urbanaâ€“Champaign and the University of Maryland before joining the faculty of Virginia Tech in 1969. Krebs served as head of agricultural education and director of the summer school program. He became the Assistant Vice President for Academic Affairs in 1972, the Vice President for Special Projects in 1975, and Vice President of Administration in 1977. Alfred Krebs retired from Virginia Tech in August of 1981.
Source: In memoriam: Alfred H. Krebs, former vice president for administration, Virginia Tech, January 5, 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of the correspondence and other materials of Alfred Krebs in his capacity as Vice President for Special Projects (1975-1976). The collection also includes materials from his period as Interim Vice President for Academic Affairs (1972-1975). His duties as Vice President for Special Projects included university financial functions, chairmanship of the Computer Committee, Systems Development, Institutional Research, and the coordination of the Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Programs. There are materials regarding such subjects as consulting projects, cases from the Judicial Review committee, the Telecommunication Committee, and the University Council.

Correspondence and other documents detail the formation and management of the Computer Committtee, the creation and implementation of an Affirmative Action Plan,and procedures for implementing Title IX regulations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by subject.

controlaccess.head: Organizations:
controlaccess.corpname: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

blockquote.p: This collection has digitized material available online.
